snippet: Other nations have failed to pledge enough to take full advantage of a generous American offer to give $1 for every $2 donated.
abstract: Editorial contends pledge by donor nations of $12 billion over next three years to the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria is a vote of confidence in the programs the fund finances at a time when many nations face fiscal constraints; warns United States offer, which will match $1 for every $2 contributed by other donors, means that a lot of money may be forfeited if other nations do not step up.
lead_paragraph: Other nations have failed to pledge enough to take full advantage of a generous American offer to give $1 for every $2 donated.
